questions.question: What is the purpose of SQL?
choices: To manage and query relational databases
To design user interfaces for web applications
questions.answer: To manage and query relational databases

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to create a new table?
What is the purpose of the PRIMARY KEY constraint?
choices: To uniquely identify each record in a table
To establish a relationship between two tables
To sort the records in a specific order
To limit the size of the table
questions.answer: To uniquely identify each record in a table

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to insert new records into a table?
What is the purpose of the SELECT statement?
choices: To retrieve data from one or more tables
To modify existing records in a table
To delete records from a table
To create a new index on a table
questions.answer: To retrieve data from one or more tables

questions.question: Which SQL clause is used to filter records based on a specific condition?
What is the purpose of the ORDER BY clause?
choices: To sort the result set in ascending or descending order
To limit the number of records returned
To group records based on a specific column
questions.answer: To sort the result set in ascending or descending order

questions.question: Which SQL keyword is used to join two or more tables based on a related column?
What is the main focus of the hands-on activity in this lesson?
choices: Writing SQL queries to retrieve and filter data
Creating user interfaces for database applications
questions.answer: Writing SQL queries to retrieve and filter data
